meta_description: Philadelphia’s Magic Gardens is a mosaicked art environment, gallery, and community arts center of Isaiah Zagar’s art and public murals.
admission_text:
Philadelphia’s Magic Gardens strives to be as accessible as possible to those who are interested in visiting and learning about our spaces. This virtual tour offers an option to those who may not be able to visit or may not be able to enter some of the areas of the museum that can only be accessed by stairs.

Please note that this virtual tour only shows the outside sculpture garden of the Magic Gardens Museum, not the indoor galleries.
accessibility_text:
At Philadelphia’s Magic Gardens, we believe that art is for everybody. We strive to be as accessible as possible to all visitors. 

Please call us at 215-733-0390 ext. 116 or email education@phillymagicgardens.org with questions or suggestions about accessibility, and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.

To get a little more background on the space before your visit, please view our **[Know Before You Go slideshow](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101053432/https://www.phillymagicgardens.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Know-Before-You-Go-General-Visitors-2025.pdf)** and **[watch this video](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101053432/https://youtu.be/K2_9WCY9Q3U)** which includes captions and an ASL interpreter.

### Accessibility at the Magic Gardens Museum

  * Physical Accessibility

Please see **[this website](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101053432/https://wheelchairtravel.org/philadelphia/public-transportation/#:~:text=SEPTA%20Regional%20Rail%20is%20a,of%20which%20are%20wheelchair%20accessible.)** for useful tips to arrive at the Magic Gardens Museum on South Street via public transportation. The two closest wheelchair accessible subway stations are Walnut-Locust (8.5 blocks away) or 8th & Market (8.5 blocks away). The nearest bus stop is at 11th and South. For ADA accessible street parking **[use this map](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101053432/https://philapark.org/adaparking/)**. There are two designated spots on either end of our block of South Street.
